byline.contributor: Thomas Fuller reported from Saurpani, and Ellen Barry from Katmandu, Nepal. Reporting was contributed by Hari Kumar from New Delhi, Poypiti Amatatham from Bangkok, Chris Buckley from Katmandu, and Somini Sengupta from the United Nations.
byline.original: By THOMAS FULLER and ELLEN BARRY

abstract: Many of the villages worst-hit by earthquake in Nepal remain cut off from relief efforts due to landslides two days after quake, and Nepali authorities have begun airdropping supplies; villagers despair of receiving aid even as they bury their dead.
lead_paragraph: Residents of the Gorkha district say houses collapsed, food is running out and so far no one has arrived with aid.

headline.main: Nepal Villages Cut Off by Earthquake Wait for Aid as Death Toll Passes 4,000
headline.print_headline: Nepal Villages Cut Off by Quake Wait for Aid and Bury the Dead

snippet: Residents of the Gorkha district say houses collapsed, food is running out and so far no one has arrived with aid.
